Name: UVS_Specific_Attributes
Description: The UVS Specific Attributes class provides local attributes used by UVS observations.

Name: latitude
Description: Latitude of the sub-spacecraft point in Mean Earth frame.

Name: longitude
Description: Longitude of the sub-spacecraft point in Mean Earth frame.

Name: solar_latitude
Description: Latitude of the sub-spacecraft point in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame.

Name: solar_longitude
Description: Longitude of the sub-spacecraft point in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame.

Name: altitude
Description: Spacecraft altitude above the lunar reference sphere (radius=1737.4 km) in km

Name: altitude_above_terrain
Description: Spacecraft altitude above the lunar surface in km

Name: activity_number
Description: Activities are the main units of data collection for UVS. They correspond to a single instrument power cycle so spectra collected within a single activity are relatively near each other in both space and time. Also, the spacecraft was generally oriented during an activity for a single observational purpose. Activities are numbered based on an incrementing counter that named UVS data files as they were created onboard the spacecraft. Most activities generated a single file, so activity numbers are approximately a count of the number of instrument power cycles. Occultation activities are the exception because they generated enough spectra to span two data files. Occultation activities, therefore, are assigned the number given to their first file, and no activity is assigned the number given to the second file, i.e., activity numbering skips one number after each occultation.

Name: activity_type
Description: A short string describing the nature of each activity.

Name: AlmostLimb
Description: Observation near limb

Name: BackwardLimbWithNod
Description: Backward limb observation with instrument nod

Name: BackwardLimbWithoutNod
Description: Backward limb observation without instrument nod

Name: DarkCal
Description: Dark current calibration

Name: ForwardLimbWithNod
Description: Forward limb observation with instrument nod

Name: ForwardLimbWithoutNod
Description: Forward limb observation without instrument nod

Name: NorthLimbWithNod
Description: North limb observation with instrument nod

Name: NorthLimbWithoutNod
Description: North limb observation without instrument nod

Name: Occultation
Description: Occultation observation

Name: RamOnly
Description: Ram direction observation

Name: SodiumTail
Description: Sodium tail observation

Name: SolarBoresightCal
Description: Calibration of solar boresight

Name: SolarCal
Description: Sun calibration

Name: SouthLimbWithNod
Description: South limb observation with instrument nod

Name: SouthLimbWithoutNod
Description: South limb observation without instrument nod

Name: StarCal
Description: Star calibration

Name: SurfaceCal
Description: Lunar surface calibration

Name: TelescopeBoresightCal
Description: Calibration of telescope boresight

Name: Unknown
Description: Unknown activity

Name: average_counts
Description: Average of all pixel values (range 0-1043) in DNs or calibrated units

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_count
Description: The number of cosmic ray hits identified within the spectrum.

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_00
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_01
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_02
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_03
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_04
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_05
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_06
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_07
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_08
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_09
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_10
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_11
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_12
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_13
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_14
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_15
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_16
Description: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

Name: drive_current
Description: Thermo-Electric Cooler (TEC) Drive current in mA

Name: emission_angle
Description: If the UVS telescope boresight intersects the lunar reference sphereoid, this is the angle at the intersection between the surface normal and the vector to LADEE in degrees. 0 otherwise. Calculated by SPICE ilumin_c().

Name: in_sun
Description: An integer representing three bits. Each bit represents a geometric calculation asking whether the upper limb of the sun is above the lunar limb (including terrain) at (bit 0) the spectrum’s timestamp, (bit 1) 1 second before the start of data collection, and (bit 2) 1 second after the end of data collection. The 1 second buffers were chosen to be slightly conservative. A value of 0 means ‘definitely in shadow’ and 7 means ‘definitely in sun’. Intermediate reflect intermediate knowledge.

Name: integration_time
Description: The detector integration time for each scan, in milliseconds.

Name: moon_fixed_vx
Description: X coordinate of the spacecraft velocity in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km/s

Name: moon_fixed_vy
Description: Y coordinate of the spacecraft velocity in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km/s

Name: moon_fixed_vz
Description: Z coordinate of the spacecraft velocity in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km/s

Name: moon_fixed_x
Description: X coordinate of the spacecraft position in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km

Name: moon_fixed_y
Description: Y coordinate of the spacecraft position in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km

Name: moon_fixed_z
Description: Z coordinate of the spacecraft position in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km

Name: peak_counts
Description: Maximum value in the spectrum, either in DNs or in calibrated units

Name: phase_angle
Description: If the UVS telescope boresight intersects the lunar reference sphereoid, this is the angle at the intersection between the sun vector and the vector to LADEE, in degrees. 0 otherwise. Calculated by SPICE ilumin_c().

Name: quaternion_w
Description: W component of the spacecraft attitude quaternion in J2000 frame, estimated on-board by flight software. w is the scalar term.

Name: quaternion_x
Description: X component of the spacecraft attitude quaternion in J2000 frame, estimated on-board by flight software. w is the scalar term.

Name: quaternion_y
Description: Y component of the spacecraft attitude quaternion in J2000 frame, estimated on-board by flight software. w is the scalar term.

Name: quaternion_z
Description: Z component of the spacecraft attitude quaternion in J2000 frame, estimated on-board by flight software. w is the scalar term.

Name: raw_timestamp
Description: Uncorrected timestamp applied by the s/c relative to the J2000 epoch in units of subseconds (2^-16 sec). This timestamp was applied to each spectrum as soon as it had been fully received by flight software from the UVS instrument.

Name: saturated_pixel_count
Description: Number of pixels above a threshold value. Currently 60000 counts.

Name: scan_number
Description: A sequence number assigned to each spectrum by the instrument. This number starts at 0 every time the instrument is commanded to capture a stream of spectra with the same integration time and spacing in time. During some activities, the integration time, spacing or both were changed, causing this number to be reset one or more times.

Name: sequence_number
Description: A sequence number assigned to each spectrum within an activity. This number does not reset within an activity, so the activity_number, sequence_number pair forms a unique identifier for each spectrum just as each spectrum’s timestamp is unique.

Name: solar_incidence_angle
Description: If the UVS telescope boresight intersects the lunar reference sphereoid, this is the angle at the intersection between the sun vector and surface normal. 0 otherwise. Calculated by SPICE ilumin_c().

Name: solar_viewer_boresight_j2000_x
Description: X coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in J2000 frame.

Name: solar_viewer_boresight_j2000_y
Description: Y coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in J2000 frame.

Name: solar_viewer_boresight_j2000_z
Description: Z coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in J2000 frame.

Name: solar_viewer_boresight_me_x
Description: X coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame.

Name: solar_viewer_boresight_me_y
Description: Y coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame.

Name: solar_viewer_boresight_me_z
Description: Z coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame.

Name: solar_viewer_fov_graze_altitude_above_terrain
Description: The circular edge of the solar viewer field-of-view corresponds to a cone rooted at the spacecraft. This value is the closest approach of that cone to terrain in km, or 0 if the cone intersects.

Name: solar_viewer_graze_altitude
Description: The closest approach of the solar-viewer boresight vector to the lunar reference sphere, or 0 if it intersects

Name: solar_viewer_graze_altitude_above_terrain
Description: The closest approach of the solar-viewer boresight vector to terrain in km, or 0 if it intersects

Name: solar_viewer_graze_latitude
Description: Latitude in Mean Earth frame of the intersection of the solar viewer boresight vector and the LRO lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

Name: solar_viewer_graze_longitude
Description: Longitude in Mean Earth frame of the intersection of the solar viewer boresight vector and the LRO lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

Name: solar_viewer_graze_solar_latitude
Description: Latitude in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame of the intersection of the solar occultation viewer boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

Name: solar_viewer_graze_solar_longitude
Description: Longitude in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame of the intersection of the solar occultation viewer boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

Name: solar_viewer_solar_elongation
Description: Angle between the solar viewer boresight and the sun vector, in degrees

Name: solar_viewer_target
Description: A short string describing what is in the solar viewer’s field-of-view.

Name: DarkSky
Description: Dark sky

Name: Earth
Description: Earth

Name: Limb
Description: Limb of Moon

Name: LitMoon
Description: Sunlit part of Moon

Name: Sun
Description: Sun

Name: Unknown
Description: Unknown target

Name: UnlitMoon
Description: Dark part of Moon

Name: sun_graze_altitude_above_terrain
Description: The circular limb of the sun corresponds to a cone rooted at the spacecraft. This value is the closest approach of that cone to terrain in km, or 0 if the cone intersects terrain.

Name: tec_cold
Description: Thermo-electric cooler cold-side temperature, which is the best estimate of the temperature of the detector, in degrees centigrade

Name: tec_enabled
Description: Indicates whether the Thermo-electric cooler is active.

Name: tec_hot
Description: Thermo-electric cooler hot-side temperature, in degrees centigrade

Name: tec_setpoint
Description: The target temperature, in degrees C, to which the UVS’ thermo-electric cooler has been configured to drive the detector temperature.

Name: telescope_boresight_j2000_x
Description: X coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular J2000 frame

Name: telescope_boresight_j2000_y
Description: Y coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular J2000 frame

Name: telescope_boresight_j2000_z
Description: Z coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular J2000 frame

Name: telescope_boresight_me_x
Description: X coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame

Name: telescope_boresight_me_y
Description: Y coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame

Name: telescope_boresight_me_z
Description: Z coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame

Name: telescope_earth_elongation
Description: Angle between the telescope boresight vector and the Earth vector, in degrees

Name: telescope_ecliptic_declination
Description: Angle between the telescope boresight vector and the plane of the ecliptic

Name: telescope_fov_graze_altitude_above_terrain
Description: Altitude above terrain in km of the vector through the edge of the telescope field of view closest to the moon center or 0 if the vector intersects terrain

Name: telescope_graze_altitude
Description: Altitude above the reference sphere in km of the telescope boresight vector or 0 if the vector intersects the reference sphere

Name: telescope_graze_altitude_above_terrain
Description: Altitude above terrain in km of the telescope boresight vector or 0 if the vector intersects terrain

Name: telescope_graze_latitude
Description: Latitude in Mean Earth frame of the intersection of the telescope boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

Name: telescope_graze_longitude
Description: Longitude in Mean Earth frame of the intersection of the telescope boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

Name: telescope_graze_solar_latitude
Description: Latitude in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame of the intersection of the telescope boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

Name: telescope_graze_solar_longitude
Description: Longitude in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame of the intersection of the telescope boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

Name: telescope_solar_elongation
Description: Angle between the telescope boresight and the sun vector in degrees

Name: telescope_sun_azimuth
Description: Azimuth in degrees of the sun vector in UVS telescope frame. This is approximately the angle between the Telescope boresight and the sun vector projected onto the LADEE radiator panel

Name: telescope_sun_elevation
Description: Elevation in degrees of the sun vector in UVS telescope frame. This is approximately the angle between the sun vector and the LADEE radiator on which UVS is mounted

Name: telescope_target
Description: A short string describing what is in the telescope’s field-of-view.

Name: DarkSky
Description: Dark sky

Name: Earth
Description: Earth

Name: Limb
Description: Limb of Moon

Name: LitMoon
Description: Sunlit part of Moon

Name: Sun
Description: Sun

Name: Unknown
Description: Unknown target

Name: UnlitMoon
Description: Dark part of Moon

Name: uvs_timestamp
Description: A timestamp applied to the spectrum by the UVS instrument, in msec since UVS’ firmware booted. This provides a way to measure relative time that is independent of the spacecraft clock. It is not synchronized with that clock, and it starts at 0 during every UVS activity.

Name: valid_checksum
Description: True if the packet received by the spacecraft from UVS contained one spectrum with a valid checksum, False otherwise.

Name: predicted_attitude_flag
Description: 0 indicates spacecraft attitude estimated onboard by flight software was used to generate the metadata for this spectrum. 1 indicates that the attitude commanded by ground controllers was used. Onboard estimated attitudes were used for all spectra except when they were unavailable.

Name: LADEE
Description: This is the umbrella class for the LADEE mission dictionary.
